DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether priority-based patient navigation improve patient satisfaction , quality life ( QOL ) , depression compare screening-and-referral socioeconomically disadvantage woman 's health patient depression . The investigator goal establish patient-driven , effective , generalizable , disseminable intervention reduce depression-related disparity improve outcome .
DOC.detailed_description: - In comparative effectiveness study , 200 participant patient University Rochester Women 's Health Practice Highland Woman 's Health report significant depressive symptom randomize either PSP ( Personal Support Progress ) ESR ( Enhanced Screening Referral ) . Participants assign PSP work patient navigator prioritize concern , develop personalize care plan , implement plan . Participants assign ESR receive personalize report community resource may helpful identified need . - The investigator use simple 1:1 randomized design treatment assignment conduct use random number generator . All analysis follow intent-to-treat protocol , participant randomize follow data collection analyze accord randomize condition - Each participant assess 4 time outcome change : baseline , post treatment ( 4 month ) , two follow ( 7 10 month ) . - Assessments self report iPads link directly Red Cap database .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed depression ( PHQ9 score 10 high ) Patient University Rochester Women 's Health Practice Highland Women 's Health Monroe County resident English speaking Currently receive case management service In need acute psychiatric service Unable commit duration project
